item.title: Ousmane Dembele insists Real Madrid will not 'be the same' without Karim Benzema
item.author: Sean Walsh
item.description: Karim Benzema has left Real Madrid to join Saudi Pro League champions Al Ittihad, and Barcelona winger Ousmane Dembele believes they will be a worse team for it.

item.title: Enzo Fernandez's father reveals hope for new role at Chelsea
item.author: Sean Walsh
item.description: Chelsea midfielder Enzo Fernandez is excited to work under Mauricio Pochettino and will ask the head coach to play him higher up the pitch, according to the player's father.

item.title: Ousmane Dembele names Real Madrid star as best 'one-on-one' winger in the world
item.author: Sean Walsh
item.description: Barcelona winger Ousmane Dembele has hailed a Real Madrid rival as the best 'one-on-one' winger in world football alongside Milan's Rafael Leao.

media:thumbnail.caption: Dembele was generous in his praise | David Ramos/GettyImages

item.title: Gareth Southgate reveals Liverpool's role in Trent Alexander-Arnold's new position
item.author: Sean Walsh
item.description: Gareth Southgate has commented on how Liverpool's use of Trent Alexander-Arnold will impact his role in the England team.

item.title: Christian Eriksen backs Rasmus Hojlund to join Man Utd

item.title: Bukayo Saka injury: Gareth Southgate provides update on England & Arsenal winger
item.author: Sean Walsh
item.description: England beat Malta 4-0 in their Euro 2024 qualifier on Friday evening, but Arsenal winger Bukayo Saka had to be subsituted at half-time with an ankle injury.

media:thumbnail.caption: Saka sustained an ankle problem | Mike Hewitt/GettyImages

item.title: Martin Tyler leaves Sky Sports after 33 years
item.author: Sean Walsh
item.description: Sky Sports have confirmed that Martin Tyler has stepped down from his role as their main football commentator ahead of the 2023/24 season. Tyler joined Sky back in 1990 shortly before the inauguration of the Premier League.

media:thumbnail.caption: Tyler is leaving Sky Sports | Tom Dulat/GettyImages

item.title: Football transfer rumours: De Gea likely to leave Man Utd; Arsenal face fight in Havertz race
item.author: 90min
item.description: Saturday's roundup of transfer rumours includes news on David de Gea's uncertain Man Utd future, Arsenal's pursuit of Chelsea's Kai Havertz being complicated by Bayern Munich, Real Madrid's interest in Kylian Mbappe and more.

media:thumbnail.caption: De Gea and Havertz are in Saturday's headlines | James Gill - Danehouse/Getty Images, Richard Sellers/Getty Images

item.description: Player ratings from France's 3-0 win at Gibraltar in Euro 2024 qualifying, where Kylian Mbappe and Olivier Giroud were among the scorers.

media:thumbnail.caption: France beat Gibraltar in the Algarve | THOMAS COEX/GettyImages

item.title: Chelsea hoping to beat Premier League clubs to signing of Nicolas Jackson
item.author: Sean Walsh & Graeme Bailey
item.description: Villarreal forward Nicolas Jackson is one of La Liga's finest young forwards and has plenty of suitors from the Premier League, with Aston Villa, Bournemouth, Chelsea and Newcastle United looking into a deal.

item.title: Bukayo Saka hauled off with injury in England's match at Malta
item.author: Sean Walsh
item.description: Bukayo Saka was forced off with injury in England's Euro 2024 qualifier at Malta on Friday,. The Arsenal winger rolled his ankle under a heavy challenge in the first half and was replaced by Phil Foden.

media:thumbnail.caption: Saka was withdrawn at the break | PAUL ELLIS/GettyImages

item.title: Malta 0-4 England: Player ratings as Three Lions cruise to Euro 2024 qualifying win
item.author: Sean Walsh
item.description: Player ratings from England's 4-0 win at Malta in Euro 2024 qualifying. An own goal put the Three Lions ahead, before strikes from Trent Alexander-Arnold, Harry Kane and Callum Wilson rounded off the scoring.

item.title: Tottenham reach agreement to sign Dejan Kulusevski on permanent deal from Juventus
item.author: Sean Walsh & Graeme Bailey
item.description: Dejan Kulusevski will join Tottenham Hotspur on a permanent transfer from Juventus after the two clubs agreed to a €30m fee. Spurs have negotiated this number down from the €35m figure in his loan contract.

media:thumbnail.caption: Kulusevski will stay at Spurs | Michael Regan/Getty Images

item.title: Bayern Munich step up interest in Arsenal target Kai Havertz

item.description: Kai Havertz could leave Chelsea this summer following interest from Arsenal and Bayern Munich. Real Madrid were previously in talks over a transfer but were put off by the Blues' £70m asking price.

item.title: Kyle Walker in talks with Bayern Munich over summer transfer

item.description: Bayern Munich are in negotiations with Kyle Walker over a move from Manchester City. The right-back has one year left to run on his contract and is open to a switch to Germany.

item.title: Canadian legend Atiba Hutchinson looking to make Concacaf history
item.author: Abel Folgar
item.description: The Canadian Men's National Team wants glory at this summer's 2023 Concacaf Nations League Finals and team captain Atiba Hutchinson hopes the silverware is the final feather on the cap of his illustrious career.

media:thumbnail.caption: Canada midfielder Atiba Hutchinson at last year's World Cup | Yukihito Taguchi-USA TODAY Sports

item.title: Jude Bellingham admits Real Madrid's Champions League win against Liverpool helped sway transfer decision
item.author: Sean Walsh
item.description: Real Madrid beat Liverpool 1-0 in the 2022 UEFA Champions League final. Jude Bellingham watched that game in the company of Zinedine Zidane at the Stade de France and has revealed that this match helped persuade him to move to Spain.

media:thumbnail.caption: Bellingham has finally joined Real Madrid | AFP7/GettyImages
